messages.content: What is the main purpose of extending the comfyui LoadImage node with subfolder support?
The main purpose is to allow the node to select images from folders within the input directory, providing more flexibility in image selection.
How does the subfolder support in comfyui LoadImage node work?
The subfolder support allows users to input a subfolder name or path. If no subfolder is specified, the node will load images from the input directory itself.
How does the comfyui LoadImage node handle cases where the input subfolder doesn't exist or contains no images?
If the input subfolder does not exist or no images are found within it, the node will return a specific result to indicate the absence of images.
What does the document mean by "loading images in the subfolder"?
Loading images in the subfolder means selecting and processing images that are located within a specific folder, which can be identified by either a folder name or a path.
What does the default value of the subfolder parameter mean in the comfyui LoadImage node?
The default value of the subfolder parameter is an empty string, which instructs the node to load images directly from the input directory itself.
How is the comfyui LoadImage node's functionality affected when a subfolder is specified in the subfolder parameter?
When a subfolder is specified, the comfyui LoadImage node will search for images within that subfolder and load them accordingly.
What does the document illustrate through the provided images?

The document illustrates three scenarios through images: loading images from the input directory, loading images from a specified subdirectory, and handling cases where the subdirectory either doesn't exist or contains no images.
